DOC.HEAD: U.S. Pulls Some Embassy Workers, Issues Travel Advisory
DOC.TEXT: The State Department said Friday it is evacuating dependents and some workers at the U.S. Embassy in Romania and urged other Americans to leave the country because of the ``deteriorating situation'' there. The department issued a travel advisory warning Americans to avoid traveling to Romania, where numerous deaths have been reported in a violent crackdown against anti-government demonstrations. ``There has been no immediate threat directed at U.S. citizens,'' the travel advisory said, according to Nancy Beck, a State Department press officer. ``However, there has been random violence against civilians and numerous reports of deaths and injuries.'' She said the dependents of American embassy workers and ``non-essential personnel'' will be flown out of Romania. ``The department, therefore, is strongly advising U.S. citizens reident in Romania to depart and the embassy will provide assistance to those who do,'' said the department statement.
